label: Very simply, what’s the difference between weight and mass

choices.value: No difference – they’re synonyms
Mass is the amount of matter in an object, weight is the gravitational force on an object
Mass is metric, weight is imperial
Mass is a measure of size, weight is a measure of density

label: The laws of physics tell us that energy is?

choices.value: Conserved
Concerned
Constant
Contained

label: Which two elementary particles are described as “massless”?

choices.value: Photon and gluon
Muon and neutrino
Electron and proton
None of the above

label: The universe is made up of three main ingredients: ordinary matter (e.g. stars, planets, people), dark matter, and dark energy. In what proportions

choices.value: Mostly matter: 80% ordinary matter / 14% dark matter / 6% dark energy
A good mix: 33% ordinary matter / 28% dark matter / 39% dark energy
A dark stew: 5% ordinary matter / 27% dark matter / 68% dark energy
Potluck: We don’t actually know

label: Which of these phenomena inspired Albert Einstein in his development of general relativity?

choices.value: Seeing an apple drop from tree
Watching two trains move in opposite directions
The vibration of strings on a violin
Seeing a man fall off a roof
